result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court will reschedule this matter to a date where there is sufficient time to hear this matter.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Proposed Order to Seal, filed by Atty. Levine
Motion to Seal Document, filed by Atty. Levine.   **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on June 10, 2022 - APPROVED**
Motion to Dismiss Complaint with attached Exhibits, filed by Atty. Levine
Motion hearing on July 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A/Victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:49 AM Defendant Mikaela R Skiba in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Attorney Levine goes over the procedural history of the case and is asking for this matter to be set for a motion to dismiss.  Attorney Levine is further requesting for this matter to be reassigned to Judge Michael Bohren as this case is a re-file and the previous case was assigned to Judge Bohren.  The State has no objection to have this case reassigned to Judge Bohren.  The Court will grant Attorney Levine's request and orders this case be reassigned to Judge Bohren.  Attorney Levine intends on filing a formal motion no later than 06/10/2022 and is asking for a date in July.  The Court will set this matter for a motion hearing on Attorney Levine's motion to dismiss.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
